block.p: Anne Cecile Pfitzer, the daughter of Katherine Hinckley of Gingins, Switzerland, and the late Claude Andre Pfitzer, is to be married today to Emil Eduard Parker, a son of Herbert Parker of Riverdale, the Bronx, and the late Evelyn Cherry Parker. Mimi Henry, an adjunct leader of the Washington Ethical Society, will officiate at Woodend, the headquarters of the Audubon Naturalist Society in Chevy Chase, Md.

Ms. Pfitzer, 33, is keeping her name. She is an associate director of JHPIEGO, a reproductive health consulting service sponsored by Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore. She graduated from Columbia University and received a master's degree in health science from Johns Hopkins. Her mother is the director of communications for the Aga Khan Foundation, a nonprofit charitable organization in Geneva. Her father was a lawyer for the foundation.

Anne Cecile Pfitzer, the daughter of Katherine Hinckley of Gingins, Switzerland, and the late Claude Andre Pfitzer, is to be married today to Emil Eduard Parker, a son of Herbert Parker of Riverdale, the Bronx, and the late Evelyn Cherry Parker. Mimi Henry, an adjunct leader of the Washington Ethical Society, will officiate at Woodend, the headquarters of the Audubon Naturalist Society in Chevy Chase, Md.

Ms. Pfitzer, 33, is keeping her name. She is an associate director of JHPIEGO, a reproductive health consulting service sponsored by Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore. She graduated from Columbia University and received a master's degree in health science from Johns Hopkins. Her mother is the director of communications for the Aga Khan Foundation, a nonprofit charitable organization in Geneva. Her father was a lawyer for the foundation.

Mr. Parker, 32, is the deputy assistant secretary for policy and external affairs in the Health and Human Services Department's Administration for Children and Families in Washington. He graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received a master's degree in public affairs from Princeton University. His father teaches science and technology at the Isobel Rooney Middle School in the Bronx. The bridegroom's mother taught the sixth grade at Public School 197 in Manhattan.
